intro: Viguiera angustissima, commonly known as narrowleaf ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the United States and Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky soils, thriving in full sun. Its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy purple to pink flowers make it a distinctive and ornamental species. Viguiera angustissima is also valued for its ecological benefits, providing nectar for pollinators and supporting local wildlife.
